definitions.definition: if a part of your body is sore, it is painful, and often red, especially because of infection or because a muscle has been used too much

examples.text: His feet were sore after the walk.
My stomach is still sore *(= painful)* after the operation.
When I woke up my head was sore and throbbing.

definitions.definition: upset and angry, especially because you have been treated unfairly

examples.text: He was still sore at me for telling him he couldn't sing.

definitions.definition: in a bad mood; in an angry way

examples.text: I should keep out of his way. He’s like a bear with a sore head this morning.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that you are pleased to see; something that is very pleasant to look at
a subject that makes you feel angry or upset when it is mentioned

examples.text: It's a sore point with Sue's parents that the children have not been baptized yet.

definitions.definition: to be very easy to notice in an unpleasant way

examples.text: The blue building stood out like a sore thumb among the whitewashed villas.
If you wear a suit to the party, you’ll stand out like a sore thumb.

wordOrigin: Old English sār (noun and adjective), sāre (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zeer ‘sore’ and German sehr ‘very’.
